intro: Peucedanum oligophyllum, commonly known as narrow-leaved cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
